intro: Kohautia prolixipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed kohautia, is a rare and unique plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in damp, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
